That's too bad, it's useless to me.

Why is it useless to you?  Just get yourself a player that handles the MKV format such as Zoom Player or convert it to a more standard format with a tool such as Ultra Video Converter.  In the file sharing world....the MKV format is really the correct choice.

lol? This plays fine with vlc. If your trying to play this on your hdtv, then you should have figured out the only way mixing internet/hdtv is through a mediacenter pc. I suggest a zotac atom barebones kit.

VLC plays MKV fine. You're going to have to accept the format if you want to be downloading any worthwhile HD vids. Probably 49 out of every 50 BD rips on the net are MKV. If you need to stream them to your TV or something and WMP can't do it, use TVersity. It's free.

mkv is the only way to go. Works on Boxee too. Here's the correct setup:
Mac Mini + VLC +HDMI cable + HDTV = Awesome. Anything else is just stupid. Yes especially windows.
